page.title: 01Blisland Village
page.content: Blisland is a small village on the south-west edge of Bodmin Moor.It has a village green surrounded by a church,inn,shop,garage and old cottages.Nearby are Village Hall,school and mill.Many buildings are old and built from local stone and granite. Surrounding the village is an area of farmland,forest and moor.The streams and rivers join the River Camel flowing to the north coast through Wadebridge. Farming is the main activity,cattle and sheep,grow well on the local rich pasture.Hardy sheep graze on the higher moor.Some barley is grown.A local mill is still powered by a water wheel.The attractive contrasts between moorland and village,farmland and forest attract many tourists.
